result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan J Robertson

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Defendant Logan J Robertson appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Logan J Robertson.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF43 & 21CF163 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the information in both matter & waives it's reading. Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties in both matters.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant in both cases.
Status hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Logan J Robertson in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Logan J Robertson. 
2021TR001545, 2022CF000043 & 21CF163 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today in both cases and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it in both cases  Cases bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech files the informations electronically with the Court.  Atty Gumz and the Defendant received a copy of the informations through the efiling system and waives their reading. 

BY THE COURT:  Set arraignment
bond continued
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:16 PM Defendant Logan J Robertson appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address.  Atty Gumz asks that the defendant needs to do a new application; requests just bail be done today.
Court notes that the defendant was in the Treatment Court Program.    Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions:
Atty Gumz makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
*No violent or abusive contact with Witness 2  Initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
